title: Permanently Banned

embed.description: Provides free image upload and hosting integration for forums. Free picture hosting and photo sharing for websites and blogs.

body:
Hello. I've recently been permanently banned for "extreme nature of toxic behavior", but was I really toxic? Honestly, I'm standing here in unbelief by all of this. Is this what it comes down to in the end, having that one bad game where you must say something to your teammates and try to reason with them, just to get automatically suspended after? I swear I was not toxic, if anyone was, it's "Leona" and "Xin Zhao" in my team. I can describe the whole game which made me get "banned" but I want to keep it short as possible. I did not say even one offensive words, but still angry teammates reported me and instant feedback got me banned. Please review this, I've been playing for a very long time. Whether you lift this ban or not, it's not really that important to me, I just can't stand injustice, and I took my time to submit this out of the pure reason that it happens a lot to others too.
Here's the chat log.

replies.body:
Yes, this is unacceptable behavior. Chat exists to coordinate with your team, not argue and call people 12 year olds and tell them their parents don't love them.

Regarding "extreme nature of toxic behavior" and "I'm standing here in unbelief by all of this".

This is your seventh punishment, so that was taken into account in terms of escalating your punishment and deeming your behavior "extreme".

this being said. i still feel that riot's robotic stance dealing with toxicity perpetuates the problem. as does the stance of "mute ignore report" simply put. people dont trust the report system to deal with trolls, and take matters into thier own hands. and get mad when they get introuble instead of the troll

It's not a robotic response, it's a consistent response. Consistence is important, but I am welcome to hearing how this "perpetuates the problem". People are responsible for their own behavior. They are not accountable for anyone but themselves. Everything is 100% within their own control.

> people dont trust the report system to deal with trolls, and take matters into thier own hands. and get mad when they get introuble instead of the troll

You're making a rather blanket statement that isn't really true. The people that take matters into their own hands are by and large unsportsmanlike players. The very very very large majority of players of do not take part in this behavior. It is a very small subset of people that create negative experiences for others.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXfGYfMO,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2016-09-12T22:34:52.561+0000)
>
> It's not a robotic response, it's a consistent response.

I was hit with a zero-to-permaban by you Rioters. Care to explain how that is a "consistent response"?

YOU even admitted that it was manually performed in complete violation of standard protocol. It was easily the worst thing Riot ever did to me and it was not consistent with protocol.
Manual reviews are normal, standard, and are not in violation of anything.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXfGYfMO,comment-id=00010000000100040002,timestamp=2016-09-13T19:54:40.084+0000)
>
> Manual reviews are normal, standard, and are not in violation of anything.

1- That's not what I said. You are cherry picking the one part of my comment that was absent of the point.

2- A manual review that strikes a player with a zero-to-permaban punishment when it is not appropriate is absolutely in violation of disciplinary and ethical protocol.  

3- The fact that the permaban was later overturned is evidence of #2.

I was unjustly punished, unlike most of the people of this board subsection I was actually unjustly punished and you remained quiet during my case despite my constant requests for your aid. I am hugely disappointed that your only response to me for these past few months was the above quoted.

What do you think "consistency" is supposed to mean in this context? Never making a mistake?
Because then you simply have a different definition of the word in this context.

And you keep claiminng that it has been a "violation of protocol". What protocol? Which protocol was specifically violated? I mean, in words. What is Riot's "disciplinary and ethical protocol"?

Hell, even if you admit that such a protocol would exist, it would speak **for** Riot's consistency, in that they have a consistent protocol. That's all they can do. That and fixing cases when mistakes are made.

You have absolutely unrealistic standards when it comes to "consistency". You even feel "singled out" when a Rioter on the forums doesn't do more than his job by looking into your case personally.

> [{quoted}](name=TrulyBland,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXfGYfMO,comment-id=0001000000010004000200000001,timestamp=2016-09-14T17:01:38.588+0000)
>
> What do you think "consistency" is supposed to mean in this context? Never making a mistake?

This was not a mistake, someone deliberately pulled the trigger, against me specifically. The Rioter didn't 'accidentally' click on my case and then 'accidentally' hit zero-to-permaban.

It  needed a second review by one of the other Rioters for the zero-to-permaban punishment to be overturned. You call that a "mistake"? put a man on death row and then tell that man that "Oh, it was a 'mistake'" see how he responds... there are safeguards specifically to prevent this kind of thing, it's called ethical and disciplinary protocol.

> And you keep claiminng that it has been a "violation of protocol". What protocol? Which protocol was specifically violated? I mean, in words. What is Riot's "disciplinary and ethical protocol"?

To follow a sequence of punishments escalating from chat restriction up to permanent ban after a long time of unimproved behavior. A Rioter is not supposed to zero-to-permaban someone on a whim.

Or, as I speculate, in retaliation for some perceived slight.

> You have absolutely unrealistic standards when it comes to "consistency". You even feel "singled out" when a Rioter on the forums doesn't do more than his job by looking into your case personally.

How is it "Unrealistic standards" when Riot Tantram himself has done for many others what I asked him to do for me? do you not understand this concept? it's not complicated.

So, where's your proof that it was deliberate?
For somebody who has just recently been falsely punished, you are quite quick to condemn.
And yes, I call it a mistake. The severity of a mistake doesn't change the fact that it is a mistake.
And safeguards fail, because, again, mistakes **happen**. There is no such thing as 0% risk.

And this here?
>To follow a sequence of punishments escalating from chat restriction up to permanent ban after a long time of unimproved behavior.

That's just straight up wrong. There have been instant permabans since ever, and they're here to stay. This is literally what Tantram was trying to explain to you. 

>Manual reviews are normal, standard, and are not in violation of anything.

And that **includes** manual escalation of punishment.

And lastly:
>How is it "Unrealistic standards" when Riot Tantram himself has done for many others what I asked him to do for me? do you not understand this concept? it's not complicated.

It's unrealistic because he still doesn't reply to all of them. You're asking for consistency... well, the vast majority of such things is handled by support, not by Rioters on the forums. So the consistent thing **was** not to give you special treatment. It's not that complicated.

> [{quoted}](name=TrulyBland,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jXfGYfMO,comment-id=000100000001000400020000000100000000,timestamp=2016-09-14T19:30:01.492+0000)
>
> So, where's your proof that it was deliberate?

Are you trolling? do you even know what the words "manual review into zero-to-permaban" mean? this was not automated. Someone specifically, MANUALLY, chose to hit me with a zero-to-permaban. 

This was deliberate, by definition.

> And yes, I call it a mistake. The severity of a mistake doesn't change the fact that it is a mistake.

You must be very young... a mistake is when someone accidentally forgets their wallet at home. A mistake is not deliberate , doubly so when in order for the so-called 'mistake' to occur, one must violate a series of safeguards.

If you walk down a corridor and it says "Do not enter", that might be a mistake... but reaching a door, picking the lock and getting to the other side would not be a 'mistake', it would be a deliberate action.

> That's just straight up wrong. There have been instant permabans since ever, and they're here to stay. This is literally what Tantram was trying to explain to you. 

Correct on the first part, horrendously incorrect on the second.

1- Permabans have been here since late season 1 , early season 2, yes.

2- Zero-to-permaban, ESPECIALLY FOR "Toxicity", are very rare and have not "Always been here since ever". They began in late S3 and really started to be applied since S4 when Riot began "cracking down on toxicity".

3- Zero-to-permaban are reserved, according to Riot themselves, for the most ultra extreme toxicity fringe cases which mine was not. It was not even close... two different Rioters directly told me that my toxicity was mostly low to moderate and certainly not justifiable zero-to-permaban levels, there is a reason the permaban was later overturned.

> It's unrealistic because he still doesn't reply to all of them. 

Absolutely irrelevant, earlier you said it was 'unrealistic' which does not follow with what you are saying now, keep moving those goalposts though.

The level of egregiousness of a case has always been one of the main draws of Riot Tantram's inquiry, mine being at the maximum level should have gotten me aid but it did not, he went out of his way to not assist me and that was very disheartening, as a loyal player for many years I finally realized that Riot didn't care.

And once again, you manage to not adress a single point I made, elegantly misrepresenting them one at a time, and acting as if your definition of things are the only objective truth.

"Deliberate" is not an absolute term. A deliberate action can have unintended consequences, be done based on false information, not take into account information, etc. etc. etc.

There's a difference between a doctor deliberately killing a patient (which would be murder), and a doctor deliberately deciding for a treatment, which resulted in the death of a patient due to incompetence.

And just like that, there's a difference between deliberately punishing you unjustly, and deliberately giving you a punishment that happened to be unjust.


Also, since we now seem to suddenly agree that zero-to-permabans are not a violation of protocol in principel, want to answer that question I asked again?

>And you keep claiminng that it has been a "violation of protocol". What protocol? Which protocol was specifically violated? I mean, in words. What is Riot's "disciplinary and ethical protocol"?

As a reminder, here was your reply:

>To follow a sequence of punishments escalating from chat restriction up to permanent ban after a long time of unimproved behavior.

Given that you admit that zero-to-permabans (quite the opposite of a "permaban after a long time of unimproved behaviour") have been a thing for a while now, you admit that your answer back then was bullshit.

Also, I have yet to see the Rioters explaining to you that your toxicity was "mostly low to moderate". I still doubt it, given taht your permaban was overturned, but a 14-day ban (which is still escalated punishment) was kept in place.



And finally: You claim I'm moving the goal post, but I'm not. My point has been:

>You have absolutely unrealistic standards when it comes to "consistency". You even feel "singled out" when a Rioter on the forums doesn't do more than his job by looking into your case personally.

And that is **still** my point. You pointing out that Tantram does these things on a regular basis,  doesn't change the fact that it is **not** standard protocol. It doesn't change the fact that **most** people do not get that luxury. And it especially doesn't change the fact that you have not been singled out, just because **YOU** believe you are entitled to it.
The egregiousness of your case is neither an objective truth, nor was it even determined at the time. You **wanted** Tantram to look into it, so obviously he hadn't yet. How was he supposed to know that it was so "egregious" that it deserved special treatment?

And I'll be honest... with your absurd sense of entitlement, combined with your immense paranoia, I probably wouldn't even reply to your posts, if I were a Rioter, because it's impossible to please you anyway.
The world doesn't revolve around you. You neither deserve the super special attention you crave so much, nor are you the target of "retaliation strikes" by "rogue employees".

Alright, let's end your  nonsense.

>

> And that is still my point. You pointing out that Tantram does these things on a regular basis

Disproves your nonsensical argument and reinforces mine. Yes.

> The egregiousness of your case is neither an objective truth

Except that it is, I had never even heard of someone being hit with a zero-to-permaban with low to moderate (At most) toxicity. Every single zero-to-permaban case I'd seen was people that were ultra toxic which I was not. There is a reason my case was one of the rare ones that is overturned.

>nor was it even determined at the time.

Except it was, which is why the punishment-under-false-pretenses was overturned.

>You wanted Tantram to look into it

Yes. Finally you understand at least one thing.

> And I'll be honest... with your absurd sense of entitlement

Do you even know what a "sense of entitlement" is? I highly doubt it.

I have been punished before and even had an account permabanned in S2. I had no need to even make a thread on the forums because I knew exactly why I had gotten banned, I was warned many times that a permaban was coming but I ignored the warnings. The difference then and in this case was that in this case I had nothing remotely resembling what constitutes zero-to-permaban behavior and had not been punished in years.

Zero-to-permaban is reserved for the ultra rare fraction of an already small fraction of a percent. The ultra toxic players of which I am not, even by Riot's admission I am only low levels of toxicity on the scale.

>combined with your immense paranoia

Evidence of above quoted where? oh yeah nowhere. Next.

> The world doesn't revolve around you.

What a nonsensical statement.

Let's clarify;
Being in the correct website, in the correct board subsection, with the correct information, requesting a review from the correct person, who does that kind of thing on a regular basis I might add, when my case is ultra-egregious is not "the world revolves around me" behavior.

If I were worthy of such an extreme punishment, I would accept it. I was not, I was mistreated by Riot. This is not debatable. At this juncture I would like to know why they chose to do such a thing to me but I have no illusions or hopes that they will ever answer the question.

If they refused to aid me when my account was hit with a zero-to-permaban punishment under false pretenses/by what I speculate to be a rogue Rioter that abused his power.... then I doubt they will ever even answer the question. I had great faith in Riot prior to this incident even though I had been permabanned before, but after their atrocious mistreatment of me coupled with giving me the cold shoulder (Radio silence during the debacle) eliminated the faith I previously had.

Betraying a loyal player for no reason is wrong.

>And I said zero-to-permaban was a violation of protocol when.....? your strawman argument is noted and dismissed.

funny, how I explained where you said that **EXACTLY AFTER THE PORTION YOU QUOTED**.

The entire answers to questions you ask in this way too long post of yours, are between the very lines you post.

And you still claim that words like "egregious" are objective.


And you wonder why Riot doesn't talk to you. You appear to be basically illiterate and you believe that your opinion is objective truth. Your ego is so huge you are literally incapable of understanding another person's point of view.
Considering he's a software engineer and not part of the PB&M it's likely he doesn't know what happened with your case, especially if it was a manual review.
Holy shit dude, get over it already, you should be happy you were lucky enough to get it reduced
